author: bridge-bot
content:
<unnawut> re: **@tcoratger**
> FYI @unnawut : https://github.com/b-wagn/hypercube-hashsig-parameters/blob/9b08163f7e916ddbd8676d4d49e60438c891862f/hypercube.py#L341
@khovratovich @Benewagner I'm try to double check that I'm generating parameters for the specs in https://github.com/leanEthereum/leanSpec/pull/9/files#diff-08804a712172c6f21080d7b0e13ffa13bc2789648a62bb41be7b31bbb1934185 

So I printed more columns to compare. I'm getting the same values as most of the xmss specs PR, but I'm still missing one:

- Mapping: [XMSS Specs PR] -> [hypercube-hashsig-parameters]

*- MESSAGE_LENGTH -> ?*
- LOG_LIFETIME = 32 -> log_lifetime = 32
- DIMENSION = 64 -> num_chains = 64
- BASE = 8 -> chain_length = 8
- FINAL_LAYER = 77 -> domain_layer = 77
- TARGET_SUM = 375 -> exact match
- PARAMETER_LEN = 5 -> exact match
- TWEAK_LEN_FE = 2 -> exact match
- MSG_LEN_FE = 9 -> fixed value of 9 in the generator
- RAND_LEN_FE = 7 -> exact match
- HASH_LEN_FE = 8 -> exact match
- CAPACITY = 9 -> exact match
- POS_OUTPUT_LEN_PER_INV_FE = 15 -> mh_elements_per_invocation = 15
- POS_INVOCATIONS = 1 -> mh_pos_invocations = 1

The closest constant to the spec's `MESSAGE_LENGTH` is the generator's `PERMUTATION_WIDTH_MESSAGE_HASH` but it's set to 24 so I'm not sure. 

Can I safely assume that `hypercube-hashsig-parameters` works with `MESSAGE_LENGTH` by default?

author: bridge-bot
content: <Benewagner> Message length in field element is just set high enough such that you can encode 32 bytes with it, and the script (and code) asserts somewhere that this is not too large for hashing it with tweaks etc using Poseidon 24
